FuncDef: The display trunkfwdtbl eth-trunk command displays information about an Eth-Trunk forwarding table.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about a forwarding table of a specified Eth-Trunk interface.
The value is a string of 0 to 65535 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the slot ID of an Eth-Trunk interface whose forwarding table is displayed.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After an Eth-Trunk interface is configured, you can run the display trunkfwdtbl eth-trunk command to view information about the Eth-Trunk forwarding table.
The Eth-Trunk forwarding table shows the forwarding status of the Eth-Trunk interface. The forwarding table is divided into two columns:
MASTER: master member interfacesSLAVE: backup member interfacesIf no backup interfaces are configured but there are other Up Eth-Trunk member interfaces, these member interfaces are used as backup interfaces shown in the SLAVE column.If no backup interfaces are configured and no other Eth-Trunk member interfaces are Up, interfaces displayed in SLAVE column are the same as those displayed in MASTER column, that is, interfaces back up themselves.

Prerequisites
An Eth-Trunk interface has been created.
Precautions
A maximum of 64 physical interfaces can be added to the same Eth-Trunk interface. In this case, the forwarding table contains 64 forwarding entries.
